abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Fourth Structural Adjustment Credit
            (SAL IV) of the International Development Association (IDA)
            to the Republic of Togo. SAL IV objectives were to increase
            economic growth to more than 4 percent per annum by 1992,
            limit inflation to 3 percent or less, reduce the current
            account deficit to 7.7 percent of Gross Domestic Products
            (GDP) by 1992, improve the Government's financial
            situation, and improve the delivery of social services.
            Bank's performance was satisfactory. Borrower's
            performance was satisfactory. The key lessons learned were
            as follows: a) signs of commitment to reforms ; b) limits of
            SALs as an instrument of reform; c) need for a comprehensive
            approach to public resource management reforms; d)
            supervision of SALs; and e) relations between Togo and the Bank.
